quest.name: In the Dark of Night
journal:
Kipih Jakkya is eager to set out with you and Noctis.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

Kipih informs you that there have been new sightings of mechanical soldiers in the Twelveswood. In order to ascertain the truth of these rumors, it is decided that you will head to Gridania to seek out eyewitnesses.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

Upon arriving in Gridania, you proceed to make inquiries about the mechanical soldiers. While no one you speak with turns out to be an eyewitness, you are reasonably satisfied that the magitek troopers are indeed here in the Twelveswood. It is time to take your findings to Kipih, who awaits at Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre.

Based on your findings, Kipih believes that you should be able to find the magitek troopers if you were to keep watch at the Bramble Patch, in the East Shroud. Eager as ever, Noctis sets out immediately, and at Kipih's behest you hurry after him.

At the Bramble Patch, you are reunited with Noctis and begin lying in wait. As the night deepens, a bloodcurdling roar cuts through the silent gloom, and you hasten towards the sound to come face-to-face with a fell fiend. Though the creature is fearsome, working together with Noctis, you succeed in laying it low.

Noctis is perturbed that a daemon, a monster from his world, has also found its way to Eorzea. Taking your rest after the taxing battle, you trade tales over a simple camp meal and learn a little more about Noctis─and perhaps yourself as well.

Back in Gridania, Noctis is crestfallen at being unable to find a way home, but Kipih promises that she will keep working to uncover more leads. Not given to waiting around, Noctis goes off to explore Gridania, and Kipih bids you accompany him.
You find Noctis browsing the Black Rabbit Traders' stall; it appears he is quite taken by the fashion of Eorzea. Your visitor is keen to explore some more, and you are happy to oblige him.
objectives: Wait at the designated location in the East Shroud.
Speak with Kipih Jakkya in Gridania.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Whew... That wasn't an interview─it was an interrogation.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: Ready to depart? Excellent! Our destination is the Twelveswood─more of those mechanical soldiers have been sighted there.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: To be sure, my colleague only heard the rumors. I suggest first heading to Gridania and seeking out the witnesses.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Sounds good. Let's get going.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: Ah, wait! New as you are to Eorzea, you may struggle to find your way around. Permit me to show you to Gridania.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Alrighty. Lead the way.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: Hopefully this outing will yield some answers...

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Wh-What? I'm not slackin' off or anything. Just checking out the clothing. Some really neat stuff here.

dialogue.name: HADREFORT
dialogue.text: Mechanical soldiers? My apologies, but I'm not familiar with the rumors.

dialogue.name: MARCQUELORT
dialogue.text: Well, I am. Fellow I know claims he came upon them near the Hawthorne Hut in the East Shroud. At first he thought they were men, but on closer inspection, he says they were more like dolls.

dialogue.name: HADREFORT
dialogue.text: And you didn't think to share this little tidbit with me, Brother? If I were to fall victim to these abominations, I shall consider my death on your head.

dialogue.name: ROUSTEBANT
dialogue.text: Heard about the mechanical soldiers, have you? Indeed, they have been sighted in the East Shroud.

dialogue.name: ROUSTEBANT
dialogue.text: While I do not personally know the details, the Wood Wailers are in a state of heightened vigilance throughout the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: MITAINIE
dialogue.text: Mechanical soldiers? As a matter of fact, one of our sentries at Amarissaix's Spire reported encountering them while patrolling the Bramble Patch.

dialogue.name: MITAINIE
dialogue.text: At first he took them to be scarecrows, but as he approached them, they suddenly sprang to life and set upon him. We suspect that they are some heretofore unknown imperial weapon, and we are deliberating a response even as we speak.

dialogue.name: MITAINIE
dialogue.text: If your path takes you near that area, you would do well to exercise all caution.

dialogue.name: HADREFORT
dialogue.text: I pray I do not run afoul of these mechanical monstrosities alone in the forest. The mere thought chills me to the spine...

dialogue.name: MARCQUELORT
dialogue.text: As I said, the fellow I know claims he came upon the mechanical soldiers near the Hawthorne Hut in the East Shroud. At first he thought they were men, but on closer inspection, he says they were more like dolls.

dialogue.name: ROUSTEBANT
dialogue.text: The mechanical soldiers were sighted in the East Shroud. While I do not personally know the details, the Wood Wailers are in a state of heightened vigilance throughout the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: MITAINIE
dialogue.text: One of our sentries at Amarissaix's Spire reported encountering the mechanical soldiers. We suspect that they are some heretofore unknown imperial weapon, and we are deliberating a response even as we speak.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Cat-people... Cat-people everywhere... Y'jhimei wasn't kidding.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: So, were you able to learn anything about the mechanical soldiers?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A man saw them near the Hawthorne Hut.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A Wood Wailer encountered them at the Bramble Patch.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: I see! In that case, if we were to keep watch at the Bramble Patch, we should be able to find them eventually.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Well then, what're we waiting for?

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: Wait just a─

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: Please hurry after Noctis! The Twelveswood can be a veritable maze even for the locals, and it wouldn't do if he were to lose his way!

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: Please hurry after Noctis! The Twelveswood can be a veritable maze even for the locals, and it wouldn't do if he were to lose his way!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: It's good that we took care of the daemon, but there weren't any clues this time either. <sigh>

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: This the area, is it?

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: No luck so far. Guess we play the waiting game.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: You hear that!? C'mon, let's check it out!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: What the─!? That's a daemon!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: That thing's dangerous. We can't leave it running around.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Heh, you're up for it too, eh? Come on then, let's do it!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: First magitek troopers, now a daemon... What the hell's going on?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Let's take a rest for now.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: All that fighting made me hungry...

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Yeah, after a fight like that, I could certainly use a break.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, I'm pretty hungry too.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Right, let's set up camp!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: So, what's your story? Why do you go around doing what you do?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What's your purpose?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Protecting those dear to me.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Supporting those dear to me.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Just being with my friends.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Protecting, huh? You and Gladio would get along, I bet. The big guy's always ready to throw himself into harm's way for us.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Supporting, huh? Come to think of it, you do give off Ignis vibes. Specs is always hovering around, ready to pick up after us.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: What, you just wanna hang out with your friends? Heh, you're Prompto all over again. He's the life of the party, always ready with a quip to make us smile.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: We were traveling together─me and him and a couple of others. Hearing your story, I couldn't help but be reminded of them...

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: ...My purpose? That's a tough one. I guess you could say...it's keeping a promise.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: But I can't do that while I'm here. I have to get back to my own world.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Somehow...

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: So, how did you fare? Were you able to find your answers?

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Nope. We found only more questions.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Like how the hell a daemon ended up here as well.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: A daemon?

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: It's...a kind of monster.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: From your world, I assume. And it somehow came to be here, in Eorzea...

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: I'm no naturalist, but I imagine it being similar to a voidsent.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: And if even a monster such as that could find its way to our world, then surely─surely you can find your way back too!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Yeah, I hope so...

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: I'll keep working with my colleagues to find new leads. So just sit tight for now.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Actually, I'd rather go for a walk, check out the area a little. That's cool, yeah?

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: Well, it should be safe enough if you keep close to the city...

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Great. See ya later.

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: Ah! Wait just a─

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: <sigh> There he goes again...

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: Though I do not think that Noctis would disappear on us, I would feel much better knowing you were with him. Will you go and keep him company?

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: I promise to have new information to share before long, so see that you both return soon, all right?

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: I promise to have new information to share before long. See that you both return soon, all right?

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Oh, hey. What's up?

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Well, you can tell Kipih she doesn't need to worry. I can take care of myself, and I'm not about to run off somewhere.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: I was just checking out the clothing at this stall here. And as I was browsing, the shopkeeper offered me some stuff for free.

dialogue.name: MAISENTA
dialogue.text: Your friend has a fine physique and exceptional fashion sense. Having an attractive young man such as him model our garments is the best form of advertisement.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Thanks, lady.

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Anyway, I wanna explore some more. You're cool to hang out for a bit, yeah?

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Careful! That's not your average monster!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: I don't like the looks of that pillar!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Whoa, so that's how it works! I owe you one!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Ugh, that thing's trouble! We gotta do something about it!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Two pillars this time! I'll take one, you take the other!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: Nothin' to it!

dialogue.name: NOCTIS
dialogue.text: You gotta be kidding me...
